intro: Ataxia hookeri, commonly known as the hooker's ataxia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Ataxia hookeri is often found in wetland or swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
